passages.text: Briefing takeaways: Confident on reaching 2025 guidance; KOL resumption on track and more expected into Sep- Oct; Buy
2367. HK 12m Price Target: HK\\$71.00 Price: HK\\$54.85 Upside: \(29.4\%\)

We attended Giant Biogene's 1H25 results (see our Earnings review) briefing on Aug 28. Overall we think the tone is quite constructive on both short term recovery and LT upside with key highlights including

1) reiterating 2025 guidance with sales/NI up \(25 - 28\% /21 - 24\%\) yoy (vs. GSe at \(25\% /16\%\) ) at RMB6.9-7.1bn/2.5-2.6bn (vs. GSe at RMB6.9bn/2.4bn); in particular, full year guidance implied a decent amount of investment budgeted in 2H25 for brand revitalization and traffic resumption;

2) KOL resumption on track and expecting more line-ups including top tiers into Sep-Oct ahead of Double 11. Good progress has been made with Austin Li resuming the product link in his livestreaming and promoting Comfy's star SKUs in recent reality show;

3) Robust star SKU ramp up with healthy acquisition and repeated purchase: Comfy Luminous Facial Cream (焦点面霜) exceeded full year 2024 revenue size in 1H25 at RMB200mn+ with \(60\% +\) new customer mix and healthy repurchase rate similar to single use essence; Classic SKU single use essence maintained a \(60\%\) new consumer mix and mgmt still aims for RMB3-4bn LT headroom. The higher end-product line launched early this year, precise and intensive repair series (倾城密修系列), also beat mgmt's internal target and entered c.80 Sephora stores in Aug. On top of it, Comfy plans to launch a promising new star SKU in 1H26, with confidence to achieve the year 1 sales same as single use essence, followed by more new series into 2027-28. The second brand Collengens has also been growing fast on track of FY25 guidance at RMB1bn sales.
4) New drivers emerging for offline channel and overseas:
Market cap: HK\\$58.7bn / \$7.5bn Enterprise value: HK\\$50.4bn / \$6.5bn 3m ADTV: HK\\$804.6mn / \$102.6mn China/ Korea Cosmetics & Jewelry M&A Rank: 3 Leases incl. in net debt & EV?: Yes
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Research estimates. See disclosures for details.

Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Research estimates.
Comfy has opened 24 offline stores in 1H25 and is expanding into specialty channel including DFS, Sephora, Sam's Club. The company has also entered Southeast Asia including Watson's in Malaysia.

GS View: We understand the size price moved negative post briefing reflecting market concerns e the company achieving full year sales guidance (i.e. \(30\% +\) online growth in 2H25. Channama is showing a negative MSD% yoy Douyin GMV Aug to date in absence of top tier KOLs, while Double 11 is facing a tough comp. However, we are not as negative as per our channel check, Tmall/JD in Aug should track more positive with partial resumption of Austin Li. Besides, Aug is the low season and Sep- Oct closer to Double 11 will be more crucial that mgmt stays positive in KOL resumption. We believe risk reward is turning more attractive with the stock trading at 21x over a bearish view of RMB2.4bn adj NI (vs. company guidance of RMB2.6bn), implying \(20\%\) online growth in 2H25. The company also has extra buffer in offline and cost savings. Stay Buy on the name.
1. 2025 guidance unchanged: Mgmt reiterated full year 2025 guidance - sales/NI up \(25 - 28\% /21 - 24\%\) yoy at RMB6.9-71bn/2.5-2.6bn.

GPM: Mgmt attributed the 0.7ppt yoy GPM contraction in 1H25 to the higher sales mix of second- tier SKUs including lotion, emulsion, etc as these new SKUs ramp up, while the pricing remains stable with strict control and the company has been optimizing supply chain for further cost saving. For FY25, mgmt reiterated the guidance with 1- 2ppt yoy contraction in GPM, implying a GPM of \(80.1\% - 81.1\%\) .

Selling expenses ratio: The 1.1ppt contraction in selling expenses ratio in 1H25 is mainly driven by 1) Enhanced operational efficiency; 2) Lower KOL fees and lower KOL livestreaming mix; 3) JD (with lower selling expenses ratio) delivering faster growth than other platforms. With the cost savings in 1H25, mgmt have budgeted decent amount of investment in 2H25 for brand revitalization, star SKUs/new SKUs promotion, and Double 11 marketing and maintained the guidance at LSD%- MSD% growth in selling expenses ratio in 2025.

Comfy: Star SKUs Single use essence/Medical dressing contributed to c. \(30\% /25\%\) of Comfy sales in 1H25 per mgmt, along with new SKUs ramping up - Comfy Luminous Facial Cream (焦点面霜) reached RMB200mn+ sales in 1H25 with \(60\% +\) new customer mix and healthy repurchase rate similar to single use essence, surpassing FY2024; Aqua Luminous series (吨吨系列) and Ginsenoside series (秩序系列) both grew faster than company total. Mgmt continues to see vast potential and targets for RMB3- 4bn sales for star SKU Recombinant Collagen Single Use Essence in LT, sitting in a RMB180bn repairing skincare market, and the product is still seeing \(60\% +\) new customer mix. The Precise and Intensive Repair series (倾城密修系列) has also been receiving decent feedback since its launch. Into 2H25, the

company will launch limited gift version for Comfy star SKUs during festivals like Chinese Valentines' Day. Mgmt also mentioned they'll launch a new star SKU in 1H26, targeting to reach the first year sales of single use essence at its launch year, and new series will be launched in 2027\~2028.

- Collgene: The brand has been growing in line with mgmt expectation in 1H25, and the guidance for RMB1bn sales in FY25 is unchanged. Collgene has been growing rapidly in online channels while offline channel Chuangkeun saw slight toy declines.

- Online: Tmall/Douyin contributed to c.40%/35%+ of online sales in 1H25 per mgmt, with relatively stable expenses ratio. Mgmt highlighted the outperformance of JD, that carries lower expenses ratio and contributed to better ROI, through penetrating into high-value customers on JD with cross-selling of skincare and medical device products. The company is also making efforts in enhancing in-house livestreaming capacity, improving KOL livestreaming matrix, and reducing reliance on individual KOLs, to further improve online operation efficiency.

- Offline: Hospital and clinic channel delivered robust growth in 1H25 and in line with mgmt expectation. Meanwhile, the company is expanding to more high-quality offline channel including Hainan&South Korea DFS, Sephora, and Sam's Club. In 1H25, the company has opened 24 offline stores and will continue store network expansion into 2H26. For OTC channel, the company will put increasing focus on store productivity instead of POS expansion. Mgmt maintained 10% yoy growth guidance for offline channel in FY25.

- Overseas expansion: The company has entered Southeast Asia market, including Watson's in Malaysia, as well as Seoul DFS, in addition to social media presence on Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok in collaboration with local KOLs to promote brand image overseas.

5. KOL livestreaming resumption and Brand revitalization: Mgmt commented Jul and Aug are slow seasons for KOL livestreaming for beauty industry while the company will have more KOL line-up into Sep-Oct preparing for Double 11 similar to previous years. On brand revitalization, the company is actively working to improve brand perception through: a) Enhancing overall consumer experience; b) Increasing transparency through factory tours for consumers/industry experts; c) Public welfare activities like empty bottle recycling programs; d) Strengthening medical endorsements through partnerships with professional medical institutions.
6. Update on MA approval: Approval processes are proceeding smoothly, and the company is actively preparing for commercialization post approval per mgmt.
Valuation methodology: Our 12-month TP of HK\$71 is based on a 22x 2027E P/E discounted back to mid-2026E using a 9.6% COE.
Key risks: Slower-than-expected growth/intensified competition in the professional skin treatment market; inability to develop successful products; regulatory risk.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

The price and value of investments referred to in this research and the income from them may fluctuate. Past performance is not a guide to future performance, future returns are not guaranteed, and a loss of original capital may occur. Fluctuations in exchange rates could have adverse effects on the value or price of, or income derived from, certain investments.

Certain transactions, including those involving futures, options, and other derivatives, give rise to substantial risk and are not suitable for all investors. Investors should review current options and futures disclosure documents which are available from Goldman Sachs sales representatives or at https://www.theocc.com/about/publications/character- risks.jsp and https://www.goldmansachs.com/disclosures/cftc_fom_disclosures. Transaction costs may be significant in option strategies calling for multiple purchase and sales of options such as spreads. Supporting documentation will be supplied upon request.

Differing Levels of Service provided by Global Investment Research: The level and types of services provided to you by Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research may vary as compared to that provided to internal and other external clients of GS, depending on various factors including your individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communication, your risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g., marketwide, sector specific, long term, short term), the size and scope of your overall client relationship with GS, and legal and regulatory constraints. As an example, certain clients may request to receive notifications when research on specific securities is published, and certain clients may request that specific data underlying analysts' fundamental analysis available on our internal client websites be delivered to them electronically through data feeds or otherwise. No change to an analyst's fundamental research views (e.g., ratings, price targets, or material changes to earnings estimates for equity securities), will be communicated to any client prior to inclusion of such information in a research report broadly disseminated through electronic publication to our internal client websites or through other means, as necessary, to all clients who are entitled to receive such reports.

All research reports are disseminated and available to all clients simultaneously through electronic publication to our internal client websites. Not all research content is redistributed to our clients or available to third- party aggregators, nor is Goldman Sachs responsible for the redistribution of our research by third party aggregators. For research, models or other data related to one or more securities, markets or asset classes (including related services) that may be available to you, please contact your GS representative or go to https://research.gs.com.
Disclosure information is also available at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html or from Research Compliance, 200 West Street, New York, NY 10282.

You are permitted to store, display, analyze, modify, reformat, and print the information made available to you via this service only for your own use. You may not resell or reverse engineer this information to calculate or develop any index for disclosure and/or marketing or create any other derivative works or commercial product(s), data or offering(s) without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. You are not permitted to publish, transmit, or otherwise reproduce this information, in whole or in part, in any format to any third party without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. This foregoing restriction includes, without limitation, using, extracting, downloading or retrieving this information, in whole or in part, to train or finetune a machine learning or artificial intelligence system, or to provide or reproduce this information, in whole or in part, as a prompt or input to any such system.
